165. Adams, Edna K. (Mrs. Russel)
I am sorry this report isn't very full. The club asked but I got my father-in-law who is 87 years old to fill it in but he couldn't remember much about prices & dates for food. He came to Ponoka first in 1906, it was well settled by then & he was close to town. Then he bought a farm about 10 miles from Kinaston in 1912. It had a house & well - the wells are flowing wells in that district, I can't get good water from shallow wells although they used water from a spring a few years.

Hope it will help you some.

Sincerely,

Mrs Russell Adams
I am sorry this report isn't very full. The club asked me to go my father-in-law who is 89 years old to fill it in but he could not remember much about prices & rates for food. He came to Robson Point in 1906, at that time there was no town by the lake. He bought a farm about 10 miles from Nanaimo in 1912. He had a house & acre. The well was flowing well in that district, I can't get good water here shallow well - although they used water from a spring a few years ago.

Hope it will help you some.

Sincerely,

Mrs. Russell Adams
WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN FARMERS EAT?
A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name: C. O. Adams
Age: 89
Address: R.R. No. 2, South
Birthplace: Iowa, U.S.A.

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS
What year did you start housekeeping in western Canada? 1906
Where did you set up housekeeping? Regina, Saskatchewan
Where had you been living before that? Iowa, U.S.A.
For how many people did you prepare meals? 7
How far was it to your nearest store? 2½ miles
How often could a visit be made to the store? Frequently
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?
Bought apples by the barrel from Ontario for winter supply, tea from the Americans at first, everything was available at that time.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS
What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Red Star, First Prize
In what quantities did you buy it? 50 pounds
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? 3½¢
How much did you use Graham flour? Not used
Whole wheat flour? Not used
Was flour milled locally? Yes, far away? No, what year? 1906
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? 3½¢
What other grain products did you use? Cornmeal
Cornmeal? Yes, Whole wheat? No, Parina? No
Other? None
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? Sometimes
How did you grind it? In my flour shaker
Adams, A.J.
Kenaston, 1906
